message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with language recognition systems and proposes a deep hierarchical neural network for language identification. It also mentions the use of audio encoding, telephony, and video speech as external information sources, which are relevant to the field of computational linguistics. 

It could also belong to cs.SD (Sound) as it deals with audio encoding and speech recognition. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper proposes a deep neural network architecture and discusses the training process. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category as the paper proposes a method for improving the accuracy of language recognition systems using auxiliary tasks and attentive prediction units. 

Finally, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a less likely sub-category, but it could be relevant as the paper discusses the issues of imbalanced class priors and channel variability in the deep neural network model, which are relevant to network analysis.
